ExpressionFilterCriteria.name: ExpressionFilterCriteria
ExpressionFilterCriteria.description: Represents a condition in an expression that’s used to control the execution of macro instructions.

ExpressionFilterId.description: Required. The ID of the ExpressionFilter object that references this condition.

FilterTarget.description: Required. The target object or field used in the condition. For example, to create a condition that applies to new cases, use Case.Status as the FilterTarget.

FilterTargetValue.description: Optional. The value that’s compared to the value of the FilterTarget. For example, to create a condition that applies to new cases, use New as the FilterTargetValue.

Name.description: Optional. A label for the condition.

Operation.description: Required. Specifies the operator used to compare the target field and the target value. For example, to create a condition that applies to new cases, use EQUALS for the Operation field, as in Case.Status EQUALS New. EQUALS NOTEQUALS CONTAINS NOTCONTAIN

SortOrder.description: Required. The order in which the criteria are evaluated.
